**[Remote
Interfaces]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:18.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This instrument is equipped with the following remote interfaces.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[GP-IB1 (IEEE 488.2, See Chapter
2)]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This port is used to connect a controller such as a PC to remote
control this instrument.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Connect a controller or another device controlled by the controller to
this port.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[This instrument is controlled using remote
commands.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Two types of remote commands are provided: the instrument's native
commands
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[complying with SCPI (Standard Commands for Programmable Instruments),
and
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[commands compatible with the conventional model AQ6317 (see the
appendix).]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The GP-IB on the AQ6370D/AQ6373B/AQ6375B corresponds to this
function.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[GP-IB2 (IEEE 488.1, See Chapter
5)]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[The instrument acts as a controller for remote control of external
instruments. Connect
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[to the external device to be controlled using the instrument's program
function. This
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[functions is not available on the
AQ6370D/AQ6373B/AQ6375B.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Ethernet (See Chapter
3)]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This port is used to connect a controller such as a PC to control the
instrument remotely
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[via network.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[RS-232 (See Chapter
4)]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This port is used to connect a controller such as a PC to control the
instrument remotely.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[GP-IB1 and GP-IB2
Ports]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[The GP-IB1 and GP-IB2 ports must be used differently for different
purposes.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The GP-IB port on the AQ6370D/AQ6373B/AQ6375B corresponds to the GP-IB1
port.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The GP-IB2 port is not available on the
AQ6370D/AQ6373B/AQ6375B.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The GP-IB1 port is used when controlling the instrument from a PC.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The GP-IB2 port is used when controlling an external instrument from
the
AQ6370C/]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[AQ6373/AQ6375.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Therefore, please note the following.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• A controller such as a PC that is connected to the GP-IB2 port cannot
remotely control
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[the
AQ6370C/AQ6373/AQ6375.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Even if a turnable laser source or an external device to be
controlled by the
AQ6370C/]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[AQ6373/AQ6375 using program functions is connected to the GP-IB1 port,
it cannot
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[remote control the AQ6370C/AQ6373/AQ6375.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• The GP-IB1 and GP-IB2 ports are independent of each other. Thus, a
controller
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[connected to the GP-IB1 port cannot directly send a message to an
external device
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[connected to the GP-IB2 port.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• When a PC or other controller is connected to the GP-IB1 port,
connecting the GP-IB1
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[port with the GP-IB2 port results in improper operation.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[ ]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Do not connect these ports together, or turn OFF the system controller
function.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[ ]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The default is ON.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[1.2
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:18.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

**[Switching between Local and
Remote]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:18.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

**[Switching from Local to
Remote]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[When in Local mode, if a listen address is sent from the controller
that sets REN (remote
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[enable) and ATN to "True," the instrument enters Remote mode.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• When in Remote mode, the REMOTE indicator lights.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Keys other than the LOCAL key are
disabled.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Settings entered in Local mode are held even if switching to Remote
mode.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• When an LLO (Local Lock Out) message is received from the controller,
the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[instrument enters local lockout status. In LLO status, the LOCAL key is
disabled and
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[does not return the instrument to Local mode even when pressed. After
cancelling the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[local lockout status, press the LOCAL key. To cancel the local lockout
status, set REN
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[to "False" from the controller.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Switching from Remote to
Local]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[If you press the LOCAL key when in Remote mode the instrument enters
Local mode.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[However, it does not return to Local mode if in the local lockout
state.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• The REMOTE indicator turns off.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• All keys are
enabled.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Settings entered in Remote mode are held even if switching to Local
mode.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• When a GTL (Go to Local) message is received from the controller, the
instrument
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[enters Local mode even if REN is set to False.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}
:::

**[Buffers]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:12.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

**[Input
Buffer]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[The instrument's input buffer is a single stage 1 MB buffer. When
receiving data that
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[exceeds the buffer size, the data after the first megabyte is
discarded. The remote
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[command after the last command separator of the 1 MB of data is
deleted.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Output
Buffer]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[The instrument's output buffer is a single stage 1 MB buffer. Only the
most recent data is
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[held. (When a talker command is received while there is data in the

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[executed resulting in generation of talker data that exceeds the buffer

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• The talker output buffer is

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

Commands]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:12.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[instrument captures that command to store it in the receive buffer, and

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

Remote mode.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• When in Remote mode, the REMOTE indicator lights.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Keys other than the LOCAL key are disabled.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Settings entered in Local mode are held even if switching to Remote
mode.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• When an LLO (Local Lock Out) message is received from the controller,
the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[instrument enters local lockout status. In LLO status, the LOCAL key is
disabled and
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[does not return this instrument to Local mode even when pressed. After
cancelling the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[local lockout status, press the LOCAL key. To cancel the local lockout
status, set REN
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[to \"False\" from the controller.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Switching from Remote to
Local]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[If you press the LOCAL key when in Remote mode the instrument enters
Local mode.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[However, it does not return to Local mode if in the local lockout
state.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• The REMOTE indicator turns off.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• All keys are
enabled.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Settings entered in Remote mode are held even if switching to Local
mode.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• When a GTL (Go to Local) message is received from the controller, the
instrument
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[enters Local mode even if REN is set to False.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Note]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:12.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[The GP-IB interface cannot be used simultaneously with other
communication interfaces
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[(RS-232, USB, or Ethernet).
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:14.0pt;color:#ffffff"}**

**[Explanation]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#ffffff"}**

[The settings below are used when entering the settings that can be
entered using the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[instrument's panel keys from a controller, or when outputting settings
or waveform data
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[to the controller.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[GP-IB Address
Settings]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[When in Addressable mode, set the instrument's address within the
following range.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[0 to
30]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Each device that can be connected via GP-IB has its own unique GP-IB
address. This
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[address allows each device to be distinguished from other devices.
Therefore, when
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[connecting the instrument to a PC or other device, make sure not to set
the same
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[address on the instrument as any of the other devices.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Note]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:12.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[• Do not change an address while the controller or other devices are
using GP-IB.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Set addresses other than those used by the GP-IB2 port.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

Settings]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[Normally, you will enter AQ6370C, AQ6370D, AQ6373, AQ6373B, AQ6375 or
AQ6375B
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[mode.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[If you wish to use the commands of the AQ6317 (another product in the
series), enter
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[AQ6317. See the appendix for AQ6317 commands that are compatible with
the AQ6317.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Note]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:12.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

via the GP-IB
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[the LAN port allows you to read the status registers, as in the case

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[This instrument is equipped with an IEEE standard 488-1978 24-pin GP-IB
connector.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Use a GP-IB cable that conforms to the IEEE standard 488-1978.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Connections]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:12.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[The instrument has two ports, GP-IB1 and GP-IB2. The GP-IB2 port is not
available on
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[the
AQ6370D/AQ6373B/AQ6375B.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[GP-IB1 port: Can be connected to a PC for remote control of the
instrument from the
PC.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[GP-IB2 port: Can be connected to another instrument for remote control
of that
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[instrument using the AQ6370C/AQ6373/AQ6375's program function.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[For now, you will connect a PC to the GP-IB2 port.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Turn OFF all the power switches of the AQ6370C/AQ6373/AQ6375 and any
devices
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[to be connected to it. Connect a cable to the GP-IB2 port on the rear
panel of the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[instrument.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:12.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[Always turn OFF the power to the instrument and the PC when connecting

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Setting the GP-IB2 Port
Address]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[When in Addressable mode, set the instrument\'s address within the
following range.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[0 to
30]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Each device that can be connected via GP-IB has its own unique GP-IB
address. This
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[address allows each device to be distinguished from other devices.
Therefore, make
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[sure not to set the same address on the instrument as any of the other
devices. Also, set
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[addresses other than the instrument's GP-IB address (MY ADDRESS).
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Turning ON the System Controller
Function]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[Turn ON this function to control an external device with the
instrument\'s program
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[function.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Setting the TLS
Address]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[Specify the GP-IB address of the turnable laser source to be controlled
by the instrument.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Note]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:12.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[• A controller such as a PC that is connected to the GP-IB2 port cannot
remotely control the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[AQ6370C/AQ6373/AQ6375.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Even if a turnable laser source or an external device to be
controlled by the
AQ6370C/]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[AQ6373/AQ6375 using program functions is connected to the GP-IB1 port,
it cannot remote
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[control the
AQ6370C/AQ6373/AQ6375.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• The GP-IB1 and GP-IB2 ports are independent of each other. Thus, a
controller connected
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[to the GP-IB1 port cannot directly send a message to an external device
connected to the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[GP-IB2 port.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• When a PC or other controller is connected to the GP-IB1 port,
connecting the GP-IB1 port
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[with the GP-IB2 port results in improper operation. Do not connect
these ports together, or
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[turn OFF the system controller function. The default is ON.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:8.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Read]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This register can be read by a serial poll or the common \*STB? query.
Note that the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[information of bit 6 changes with a different reading
method.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• When read by serial
polling]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[ ]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[An RQS message is read as bit 6
information.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[ ]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[After reading, the RQS message will be
cleared.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• When read by an \*STB? common
query]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[ ]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[An MSS summary message is read as bit 6
information.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[ ]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Even after reading, the MSS message will be
held.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Bits other than bit 6 do not change.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The read action complies with the IEEE 488.2 standard.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Write]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[The contents of the register will be rewritten only when the status of
an assigned
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[status data structure has been changed. The write action complies with
the IEEE 488.2
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[standard.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Clear]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[All event registers and queues, not including the output queues and MAV
bit, will be
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[cleared by the common \*CLS command.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The clear action complies with the IEEE 488.2 standard.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Service Request Enable
Register]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:12.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

**[Read]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This register can be read by the common \*SRE?
query.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The value of bit 6, an unassigned bit, is always "0." The contents of
the register are not
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[cleared even when read. The read action complies with the IEEE 488.2
standard.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Write]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[This register can be written by the common \*SRE command.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[with the IEEE 488.2 standard.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[This register will be cleared under any of the following
conditions.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Data "0" is set using the common \*SRE
command.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Power
ON]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The contents of the register are not cleared in the following
cases.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Receipt of the \*RST
command]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Receipt of the \*CLS
command]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Device clear (DCL,
SDC)]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Operation Status
Registers]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:18.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[Operation status registers report the operation status of the
instrument. The operation
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[condition registers indicate the instrument's condition. A change in an
operation condition
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[register is latched into the operation event register. The user can
refer to the operation
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[event register to view changes in the operation status. The summary
information of the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[instrument event register is set to the OPS bit of the status byte
register. In this case,
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[only statuses corresponding to bits specified as "1" in the operation
enable register are
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[included in the summary
information.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Sequential

[• These commands are the most general
commands.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[command is
complete.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

is
complete.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

Commands]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

while it is
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The instrument does not distinguish between upper- and lower-case
letters.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[Return values are all in upper-case
letters.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

commands.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

of the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[During program execution, you can perform unique operations with

**[When Executing a Program Including "PAUSE
'\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\--'"]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[The program pauses.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[The message included in the "PAU2SE '\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\--'" line is
displayed, and the program
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[pauses. To resume execution of the program, press the CONTINUE soft
key.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[If a program is executed via remote control, the "PAUSE
'\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\--' command is ignored.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[When Executing a Program Including the "DATA INPUT
\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\--';@"

[After the program executes, a data entry window is displayed.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

@
variable.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Explanation]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:11.0pt;color:#ffffff"}**

[Because remote control via the GP-IB interface of the /AQ6375 complies
with the IEEE
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[488.2 standard, it is not compatible with the conventional model AQ6317
(complying with
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[the IEEE 488.1 standard) as to the remote commands and internal
actions.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[However, by placing the instrument in AQ6317-compatible command mode,
you can use
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[some of the AQ6317 commands. Status register operation also has
compatibility with the
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[AQ6317. When you switch the command mode, it causes all the contents of
the status
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[registers and queues and receive buffer and talker output buffer to be
initialized.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

**[Operation in AQ6317-Compatible
Mode]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:10.0pt;color:#231f20"}**

[The instrument operates as follows when it is remote controlled in the
AQ6317-]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[compatible mode.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• The majority of AQ6317 control commands and talker commands are
available.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• Talker data is output in the AQ6317-compatible
format.]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• To send multiple commands at one time, use a comma "," as a
separator.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[• If receiving multiple query commands in a single line, the instrument
outputs only data
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}

[relative to the last query command.
]{style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif;font-size:9.0pt;color:#231f20"}
